I am a political economist who studies the effects of broken political and economic institutions in the non-Western world. This website hosts papers, code and data from my research projects and also my blog, Punk Rock Poli Sci, that mixes poli sci (the politics of economic development) with a splash of punk rock (rethinking methods for scientific research in the 21st century). You can find my CV here.

I am the author of two books:

Making Democracy Safe for Business: Corporate Politics During the Arab Uprisings

The Bayesian Hitman

You can subscribe to get email notifications about new blog posts here.

Lost in Transformation: The Horror and Wonder of Logit

Once You See What Logit Is, You’ll Love It Too
R
Statistics
Proportions
The logit model for binary outcomes is poorly understood because it involves thinking in non-linear spaces. In this post, I illustrate what logit is using maps–and why people who resist logit are a bit like flat earthers.
